dasp5000.controllers

Class AudioController

  • java.lang.Object
    • dasp5000.controllers.AudioController

  • public class AudioController
extends Object
    A class to handle a single audio clip's life cycle.
    Author:
    Petri Kallio

    • Constructor Detail

      • AudioController

        public AudioController(String fileName)
                throws UnsupportedAudioFileException,
                       FileNotFoundException,
                       IOException
        Constructs a new AudioController object. The file of the parameter fileName is first opened and then an AudioContainer object is parsed from the data of the opened audio file
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the audio file to be opened
        Throws:
        UnsupportedAudioFileException - if the file format is not supported
        FileNotFoundException - if the file can not be opened
        IOException

      • AudioController

        public AudioController(AudioContainer audioContainer)
        Create a new AudioController object. The parameter is a pre-existing AudioContainer object.
        Parameters:
        audioContainer - the AudioContainer object to be controlled by this controller

      • AudioController

        public AudioController(File file)
                throws IOException,
                       UnsupportedAudioFileException
        Throws:
        IOException
        UnsupportedAudioFileException

    • Method Detail

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(String outputFilePath)
                 throws FileNotFoundException,
                        IOException
        Write the data of the AudioContainer object into a audio file. The file's name into which the data is to be written is given as parameter.
        Parameters:
        outputFilePath - the new audio file's path
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found
        IOException - if the file cannot be created

      • getAudioContainer

        public AudioContainer getAudioContainer()
        Get the AudioContainer object that corresponds to the particular AudioController object.
        Returns:
        AudioContainer object

      • getFileName

        public String getFileName()
